overview:
Davide Di Cillo is an Italian designer and entrepreneur, who applies his creativity in his business and projects. He is the founder and CEO of Thirtynine, a company focused on web and mobile development. Since 2008, with Thirtynine, Davide shipped several successful iPhone applications, placing them in the Top 20 most downloaded applications in the relative categories, totaling hundreds of thousands of downloads. He is the organizer of the South Florida iPhone meetup group, with more than one hundred members, and one of the co-organizers of Refresh Miami and Refresh Lauderdale, a South Florida tech community with thousands of members.

Prior to launching his career as an entrepreneur, Davide was the Creative Director at Random Access, a twelve-year-old web agency in Fort Lauderdale, where, for more than two years, he took care of the front-end design and development. In 2005 Davide worked as web designer for James Ross Advertising, an advertising company. In 2001 he joined the web division of Elettrodata S.r.l., an Italian company as web designer. He co-founded in 2000 Crezine.com, one of the biggest Italian communities for creative people at that time.

Born and raised in Italy, he moved in the United States in 2005, where he actually resides. Davide has a degree in Graphic Design from Instituto Europeo di Design (European Institute of Design) of Milan, Italy.

image.attribution: Scott Beale / Davide Di Cillo
